description: Meryl is a tool for counting and working with sets of k-mers that was originally developed for use in the Celera Assembler and has since been migrated and maintained as part of Canu.
name: Meryl

metadata.abstract: Â© 2020 The Author(s).Recent long-read assemblies often exceed the quality and completeness of available reference genomes, making validation challenging. Here we present Merqury, a novel tool for reference-free assembly evaluation based on efficient k-mer set operations. By comparing k-mers in a de novo assembly to those found in unassembled high-accuracy reads, Merqury estimates base-level accuracy and completeness. For trios, Merqury can also evaluate haplotype-specific accuracy, completeness, phase block continuity, and switch errors. Multiple visualizations, such as k-mer spectrum plots, can be generated for evaluation. We demonstrate on both human and plant genomes that Merqury is a fast and robust method for assembly validation.
metadata.title: Merqury: Reference-free quality, completeness, and phasing assessment for genome assemblies
